botanical_details.potentially_harmful: Ingestion may cause severe discomfort, sap may be a skin and eye irritant. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Alocasia are robust evergreen rhizomatous or tuberous perennials with large, usually peltate, leaves with conspicuous veins; insignificant flowering spathes may be followed by orange-red fruits

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow indoors in a potting mixture of equal parts of composted bark, loam and sand, in filtered light. Water freely in the growing season and provide high humidity by placing the container on a tray or moist gravel or pebbles. Apply a balanced liquid fertiliser every 2-3 weeks. Water moderately in winter. Requires a minimum temperature of 15-18°C (59-64°F)
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by seed at 23°C (73°F) as soon as ripe. Propagate by Division in spring or summer. Propagate by stem cuttings in spring
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to glasshouse red spider mite and mealybugs
